p: Due to the ZIKV outbreak in Brazil, several cases of the congenital syndrome, mainly associated with microcephaly in newborns, have been reported with the detection of viral RNA in the amniotic fluid of the affected patients ( 6). The threat posed by ZIKV has great implications not only on immediate public health but also on family economy and social resources, due to the persistent long-term sequelae of the congenital ZIKV syndrome ( 40). Reliable and sensitive surveillance of these arboviruses, which includes a system for the detection of emerging pathogens, is of paramount importance in order to effectively manage future outbreaks.
